22 #ifndef AVUTIL_PIXDESC_H
23 #define AVUTIL_PIXDESC_H
24 
25 #include <inttypes.h>
26 
27 #include "attributes.h"
28 #include "pixfmt.h"
29 #include "version.h"
30 
31 typedef struct AVComponentDescriptor {
32  /**
33  * Which of the 4 planes contains the component.
34  */
35  int plane;
36 
37  /**
38  * Number of elements between 2 horizontally consecutive pixels.
39  * Elements are bits for bitstream formats, bytes otherwise.
40  */
41  int step;
42 
43  /**
44  * Number of elements before the component of the first pixel.
45  * Elements are bits for bitstream formats, bytes otherwise.
46  */
47  int offset;
48 
49  /**
50  * Number of least significant bits that must be shifted away
51  * to get the value.
52  */
53  int shift;
54 
55  /**
56  * Number of bits in the component.
57  */
58  int depth;
59 
60 #if FF_API_PLUS1_MINUS1
61  /** deprecated, use step instead */
62  attribute_deprecated int step_minus1;
63 
64  /** deprecated, use depth instead */
65  attribute_deprecated int depth_minus1;
66 
67  /** deprecated, use offset instead */
68  attribute_deprecated int offset_plus1;
69 #endif
70 } AVComponentDescriptor;
71 
72 /**
73  * Descriptor that unambiguously describes how the bits of a pixel are
74  * stored in the up to 4 data planes of an image. It also stores the
75  * subsampling factors and number of components.
76  *
77  * @note This is separate of the colorspace (RGB, YCbCr, YPbPr, JPEG-style YUV
78  * and all the YUV variants) AVPixFmtDescriptor just stores how values
79  * are stored not what these values represent.
80  */
81 typedef struct AVPixFmtDescriptor {
82  const char *name;
83  uint8_t nb_components; ///< The number of components each pixel has, (1-4)
84 
85  /**
86  * Amount to shift the luma width right to find the chroma width.
87  * For YV12 this is 1 for example.
88  * chroma_width = AV_CEIL_RSHIFT(luma_width, log2_chroma_w)
89  * The note above is needed to ensure rounding up.
90  * This value only refers to the chroma components.
91  */
92  uint8_t log2_chroma_w;
93 
94  /**
95  * Amount to shift the luma height right to find the chroma height.
96  * For YV12 this is 1 for example.
97  * chroma_height= AV_CEIL_RSHIFT(luma_height, log2_chroma_h)
98  * The note above is needed to ensure rounding up.
99  * This value only refers to the chroma components.
100  */
101  uint8_t log2_chroma_h;
102 
103  /**
104  * Combination of AV_PIX_FMT_FLAG_... flags.
105  */
106  uint64_t flags;
107 
108  /**
109  * Parameters that describe how pixels are packed.
110  * If the format has 1 or 2 components, then luma is 0.
111  * If the format has 3 or 4 components:
112  * if the RGB flag is set then 0 is red, 1 is green and 2 is blue;
113  * otherwise 0 is luma, 1 is chroma-U and 2 is chroma-V.
114  *
115  * If present, the Alpha channel is always the last component.
116  */
117  AVComponentDescriptor comp[4];
118 
119  /**
120  * Alternative comma-separated names.
121  */
122  const char *alias;
123 } AVPixFmtDescriptor;
124 
125 /**
126  * Pixel format is big-endian.
127  */
128 #define AV_PIX_FMT_FLAG_BE (1 << 0)
129 /**
130  * Pixel format has a palette in data[1], values are indexes in this palette.
131  */
132 #define AV_PIX_FMT_FLAG_PAL (1 << 1)
133 /**
134  * All values of a component are bit-wise packed end to end.
135  */
136 #define AV_PIX_FMT_FLAG_BITSTREAM (1 << 2)
137 /**
138  * Pixel format is an HW accelerated format.
139  */
140 #define AV_PIX_FMT_FLAG_HWACCEL (1 << 3)
141 /**
142  * At least one pixel component is not in the first data plane.
143  */
144 #define AV_PIX_FMT_FLAG_PLANAR (1 << 4)
145 /**
146  * The pixel format contains RGB-like data (as opposed to YUV/grayscale).
147  */
148 #define AV_PIX_FMT_FLAG_RGB (1 << 5)
149 
150 /**
151  * The pixel format is "pseudo-paletted". This means that it contains a
152  * fixed palette in the 2nd plane but the palette is fixed/constant for each
153  * PIX_FMT. This allows interpreting the data as if it was PAL8, which can
154  * in some cases be simpler. Or the data can be interpreted purely based on
155  * the pixel format without using the palette.
156  * An example of a pseudo-paletted format is AV_PIX_FMT_GRAY8
157  */
158 #define AV_PIX_FMT_FLAG_PSEUDOPAL (1 << 6)
159 
160 /**
161  * The pixel format has an alpha channel. This is set on all formats that
162  * support alpha in some way. The exception is AV_PIX_FMT_PAL8, which can
163  * carry alpha as part of the palette. Details are explained in the
164  * AVPixelFormat enum, and are also encoded in the corresponding
165  * AVPixFmtDescriptor.
166  *
167  * The alpha is always straight, never pre-multiplied.
168  *
169  * If a codec or a filter does not support alpha, it should set all alpha to
170  * opaque, or use the equivalent pixel formats without alpha component, e.g.
171  * AV_PIX_FMT_RGB0 (or AV_PIX_FMT_RGB24 etc.) instead of AV_PIX_FMT_RGBA.
172  */
173 #define AV_PIX_FMT_FLAG_ALPHA (1 << 7)
174 
175 /**
176  * The pixel format is following a Bayer pattern
177  */
178 #define AV_PIX_FMT_FLAG_BAYER (1 << 8)
179 
180 /**
181  * The pixel format contains IEEE-754 floating point values. Precision (double,
182  * single, or half) should be determined by the pixel size (64, 32, or 16 bits).
183  */
184 #define AV_PIX_FMT_FLAG_FLOAT (1 << 9)
185 
186 /**
187  * Return the number of bits per pixel used by the pixel format
188  * described by pixdesc. Note that this is not the same as the number
189  * of bits per sample.
190  *
191  * The returned number of bits refers to the number of bits actually
192  * used for storing the pixel information, that is padding bits are
193  * not counted.
194  */
195 int av_get_bits_per_pixel(const AVPixFmtDescriptor *pixdesc);
196 
197 /**
198  * Return the number of bits per pixel for the pixel format
199  * described by pixdesc, including any padding or unused bits.
200  */
201 int av_get_padded_bits_per_pixel(const AVPixFmtDescriptor *pixdesc);
202 
203 /**
204  * @return a pixel format descriptor for provided pixel format or NULL if
205  * this pixel format is unknown.
206  */
207 const AVPixFmtDescriptor *av_pix_fmt_desc_get(enum AVPixelFormat pix_fmt);
208 
209 /**
210  * Iterate over all pixel format descriptors known to libavutil.
211  *
212  * @param prev previous descriptor. NULL to get the first descriptor.
213  *
214  * @return next descriptor or NULL after the last descriptor
215  */
216 const AVPixFmtDescriptor *av_pix_fmt_desc_next(const AVPixFmtDescriptor *prev);
217 
218 /**
219  * @return an AVPixelFormat id described by desc, or AV_PIX_FMT_NONE if desc
220  * is not a valid pointer to a pixel format descriptor.
221  */
222 enum AVPixelFormat av_pix_fmt_desc_get_id(const AVPixFmtDescriptor *desc);
223 
224 /**
225  * Utility function to access log2_chroma_w log2_chroma_h from
226  * the pixel format AVPixFmtDescriptor.
227  *
228  * @param[in] pix_fmt the pixel format
229  * @param[out] h_shift store log2_chroma_w (horizontal/width shift)
230  * @param[out] v_shift store log2_chroma_h (vertical/height shift)
231  *
232  * @return 0 on success, AVERROR(ENOSYS) on invalid or unknown pixel format
233  */
234 int av_pix_fmt_get_chroma_sub_sample(enum AVPixelFormat pix_fmt,
235  int *h_shift, int *v_shift);
236 
237 /**
238  * @return number of planes in pix_fmt, a negative AVERROR if pix_fmt is not a
239  * valid pixel format.
240  */
241 int av_pix_fmt_count_planes(enum AVPixelFormat pix_fmt);
242 
243 /**
244  * @return the name for provided color range or NULL if unknown.
245  */
246 const char *av_color_range_name(enum AVColorRange range);
247 
248 /**
249  * @return the AVColorRange value for name or an AVError if not found.
250  */
251 int av_color_range_from_name(const char *name);
252 
253 /**
254  * @return the name for provided color primaries or NULL if unknown.
255  */
256 const char *av_color_primaries_name(enum AVColorPrimaries primaries);
257 
258 /**
259  * @return the AVColorPrimaries value for name or an AVError if not found.
260  */
261 int av_color_primaries_from_name(const char *name);
262 
263 /**
264  * @return the name for provided color transfer or NULL if unknown.
265  */
266 const char *av_color_transfer_name(enum AVColorTransferCharacteristic transfer);
267 
268 /**
269  * @return the AVColorTransferCharacteristic value for name or an AVError if not found.
270  */
271 int av_color_transfer_from_name(const char *name);
272 
273 /**
274  * @return the name for provided color space or NULL if unknown.
275  */
276 const char *av_color_space_name(enum AVColorSpace space);
277 
278 /**
279  * @return the AVColorSpace value for name or an AVError if not found.
280  */
281 int av_color_space_from_name(const char *name);
282 
283 /**
284  * @return the name for provided chroma location or NULL if unknown.
285  */
286 const char *av_chroma_location_name(enum AVChromaLocation location);
287 
288 /**
289  * @return the AVChromaLocation value for name or an AVError if not found.
290  */
291 int av_chroma_location_from_name(const char *name);
292 
293 /**
294  * Return the pixel format corresponding to name.
295  *
296  * If there is no pixel format with name name, then looks for a
297  * pixel format with the name corresponding to the native endian
298  * format of name.
299  * For example in a little-endian system, first looks for "gray16",
300  * then for "gray16le".
301  *
302  * Finally if no pixel format has been found, returns AV_PIX_FMT_NONE.
303  */
304 enum AVPixelFormat av_get_pix_fmt(const char *name);
305 
306 /**
307  * Return the short name for a pixel format, NULL in case pix_fmt is
308  * unknown.
309  *
310  * @see av_get_pix_fmt(), av_get_pix_fmt_string()
311  */
312 const char *av_get_pix_fmt_name(enum AVPixelFormat pix_fmt);
313 
314 /**
315  * Print in buf the string corresponding to the pixel format with
316  * number pix_fmt, or a header if pix_fmt is negative.
317  *
318  * @param buf the buffer where to write the string
319  * @param buf_size the size of buf
320  * @param pix_fmt the number of the pixel format to print the
321  * corresponding info string, or a negative value to print the
322  * corresponding header.
323  */
324 char *av_get_pix_fmt_string(char *buf, int buf_size,
325  enum AVPixelFormat pix_fmt);
326 
327 /**
328  * Read a line from an image, and write the values of the
329  * pixel format component c to dst.
330  *
331  * @param data the array containing the pointers to the planes of the image
332  * @param linesize the array containing the linesizes of the image
333  * @param desc the pixel format descriptor for the image
334  * @param x the horizontal coordinate of the first pixel to read
335  * @param y the vertical coordinate of the first pixel to read
336  * @param w the width of the line to read, that is the number of
337  * values to write to dst
338  * @param read_pal_component if not zero and the format is a paletted
339  * format writes the values corresponding to the palette
340  * component c in data[1] to dst, rather than the palette indexes in
341  * data[0]. The behavior is undefined if the format is not paletted.
342  */
343 void av_read_image_line(uint16_t *dst, const uint8_t *data[4],
344  const int linesize[4], const AVPixFmtDescriptor *desc,
345  int x, int y, int c, int w, int read_pal_component);
346 
347 /**
348  * Write the values from src to the pixel format component c of an
349  * image line.
350  *
351  * @param src array containing the values to write
352  * @param data the array containing the pointers to the planes of the
353  * image to write into. It is supposed to be zeroed.
354  * @param linesize the array containing the linesizes of the image
355  * @param desc the pixel format descriptor for the image
356  * @param x the horizontal coordinate of the first pixel to write
357  * @param y the vertical coordinate of the first pixel to write
358  * @param w the width of the line to write, that is the number of
359  * values to write to the image line
360  */
361 void av_write_image_line(const uint16_t *src, uint8_t *data[4],
362  const int linesize[4], const AVPixFmtDescriptor *desc,
363  int x, int y, int c, int w);
364 
365 /**
366  * Utility function to swap the endianness of a pixel format.
367  *
368  * @param[in] pix_fmt the pixel format
369  *
370  * @return pixel format with swapped endianness if it exists,
371  * otherwise AV_PIX_FMT_NONE
372  */
373 enum AVPixelFormat av_pix_fmt_swap_endianness(enum AVPixelFormat pix_fmt);
374 
375 #define FF_LOSS_RESOLUTION 0x0001 /**< loss due to resolution change */
376 #define FF_LOSS_DEPTH 0x0002 /**< loss due to color depth change */
377 #define FF_LOSS_COLORSPACE 0x0004 /**< loss due to color space conversion */
378 #define FF_LOSS_ALPHA 0x0008 /**< loss of alpha bits */
379 #define FF_LOSS_COLORQUANT 0x0010 /**< loss due to color quantization */
380 #define FF_LOSS_CHROMA 0x0020 /**< loss of chroma (e.g. RGB to gray conversion) */
381 
382 /**
383  * Compute what kind of losses will occur when converting from one specific
384  * pixel format to another.
385  * When converting from one pixel format to another, information loss may occur.
386  * For example, when converting from RGB24 to GRAY, the color information will
387  * be lost. Similarly, other losses occur when converting from some formats to
388  * other formats. These losses can involve loss of chroma, but also loss of
389  * resolution, loss of color depth, loss due to the color space conversion, loss
390  * of the alpha bits or loss due to color quantization.
391  * av_get_fix_fmt_loss() informs you about the various types of losses
392  * which will occur when converting from one pixel format to another.
393  *
394  * @param[in] dst_pix_fmt destination pixel format
395  * @param[in] src_pix_fmt source pixel format
396  * @param[in] has_alpha Whether the source pixel format alpha channel is used.
397  * @return Combination of flags informing you what kind of losses will occur
398  * (maximum loss for an invalid dst_pix_fmt).
399  */
400 int av_get_pix_fmt_loss(enum AVPixelFormat dst_pix_fmt,
401  enum AVPixelFormat src_pix_fmt,
402  int has_alpha);
403 
404 /**
405  * Compute what kind of losses will occur when converting from one specific
406  * pixel format to another.
407  * When converting from one pixel format to another, information loss may occur.
408  * For example, when converting from RGB24 to GRAY, the color information will
409  * be lost. Similarly, other losses occur when converting from some formats to
410  * other formats. These losses can involve loss of chroma, but also loss of
411  * resolution, loss of color depth, loss due to the color space conversion, loss
412  * of the alpha bits or loss due to color quantization.
413  * av_get_fix_fmt_loss() informs you about the various types of losses
414  * which will occur when converting from one pixel format to another.
415  *
416  * @param[in] dst_pix_fmt destination pixel format
417  * @param[in] src_pix_fmt source pixel format
418  * @param[in] has_alpha Whether the source pixel format alpha channel is used.
419  * @return Combination of flags informing you what kind of losses will occur
420  * (maximum loss for an invalid dst_pix_fmt).
421  */
422 enum AVPixelFormat av_find_best_pix_fmt_of_2(enum AVPixelFormat dst_pix_fmt1, enum AVPixelFormat dst_pix_fmt2,
423  enum AVPixelFormat src_pix_fmt, int has_alpha, int *loss_ptr);
424 
425 #endif /* AVUTIL_PIXDESC_H */
